title: Profile page redesign with full-width editorial layout
description:
Completely redesign the profile page at `src/frontend/src/app/profile/[username]/page.tsx` to match the approved prototype at `playground/concept-b-proof.html`.

This replaces the existing sidebar + main content layout with a full-width editorial flow following the PROVE → VOUCH → STATE trust hierarchy.

**Reference the prototype HTML/CSS as the source of truth for layout and spacing.**

## Page Layout (top to bottom)

Max-width container: 1080px, centered, 24px horizontal padding.

### 1. Hero Section (grid: 280px | 1fr, gap 48px)

**Left column — Identity:**
- Avatar: 88px circle with gradient background (accent-subtle to accent-muted), serif initial, accent color
- Name: serif font, 40px, -0.01em letter-spacing
- Handle: 14px ink-tertiary
- Headline: 15px ink-secondary, 1.6 line-height
- Availability badge: green dot + text in shipped-subtle bg with shipped color, 999px border-radius
- Domain tags: using DomainTags component (from task 7)

**Right column — Burn:**
- BurnHeatmap component (from task 5)
- AgentPanel component (from task 5), placed directly below heatmap with 12px gap

### 2. Proof of Work Section
- Section label: accent-line pattern (40px × 3px accent bar, then "PROOF OF WORK" in 12px uppercase)
- Hero ProofCard (variant='hero') for the first in-progress project
- 3-column grid of compact ProofCards for shipped projects, 16px gap
- Each card gets data from the user's projects
- Tribe attribution ("via Tribe Name") shown on cards where project has tribe_id

### 3. Witnessed By Section
- WitnessCredits component (from task 7)
- Data: deduplicate collaborators across all projects, group by person showing which projects they contributed to

### 4. Footer
- ProfileFooter component (from task 7)
- Tribes column: user's tribes with member counts
- Links column: github, twitter, website from contact_links
- Info column: timezone, primary role, joined date

## GraphQL Query Updates

Update `src/frontend/src/lib/graphql/queries/builders.ts` — the `GET_BUILDER` query needs to also fetch:
- `agentTools`, `agentWorkflowStyle`, `humanAgentRatio` (already in UserType but may not be in the query)
- Burn summary data (if the backend query is available, otherwise use mock data with a TODO)

Update the page to use the new components. The page should be a **server component** that fetches data and passes props down.

## Data Transformation

The page needs to transform GraphQL data into component props:
- Projects → ProofCard props (separate in-progress hero from shipped compacts)
- Collaborators → Witness props (deduplicate across projects, group by person)
- User fields → AgentPanel props, DomainTags props, ProfileFooter props
- Burn summary → BurnHeatmap props

If burn data is not yet available from the backend, create a `generateMockBurnData()` helper that produces realistic 52-week data (similar to the prototype's JS). Mark with TODO for replacement.

## Important Notes
- This is a FULL REWRITE of the page — the old sidebar layout is completely replaced
- Do NOT modify the other components from tasks 5/6/7 — just import and use them
- Follow the existing pattern for Apollo Client usage (see `discover/page.tsx` for reference)
- The page should handle loading and error states gracefully
- All styling uses Tailwind classes mapping to design tokens in globals.css
- NO icons for information architecture — typography and layout only
- No builder score anywhere — it was removed from the design
acceptance_criteria:
- `src/frontend/src/app/profile/[username]/page.tsx` completely rewritten with full-width editorial layout
- Hero section: 2-column grid with identity left, heatmap + agent panel right
- Proof of Work section: 1 hero card + 3-column compact grid
- Witnessed By section: film credits from WitnessCredits component
- Footer: 3-column ProfileFooter component
- Uses BurnHeatmap, AgentPanel, ProofCard, BurnReceipt, WitnessCredits, DomainTags, ProfileFooter components
- Handles loading and error states
- No sidebar layout — full-width editorial flow
- No builder score displayed anywhere
- No icons used for information architecture
- Section labels use accent-line pattern
- `cd src/frontend && npx eslint .` passes
- `cd src/frontend && npx tsc --noEmit` passes
- Page renders without runtime errors
